titleStmt.title: James H. Wilkins et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10562

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: Gov. of the State of Kentucky; Whereas John W. Valentine, was fined, in the sum of Fifty Dollars, at the Feb. Term of the Warren Equity & Criminal Court, upon the charge of "carrying concealed -- a deadly weapon -- " under the following circumstances -- Said Valentine was in a rencountre, with a man largely over his size, When his antagonist drew, a rock on him, thereupon said Valentine drew a weapon, and ended the difficulty -- Although the fine may be in accordance with a rigid construction of the law -- yet we hope the circumstances under which the offense was committed, are sufficiently palliating. to authorise the clement interferance of your Excellincy, in behalf of Mr Valentine -- who is an old citizen of our place -- highly honorable and a gentleman, but a man, whose financial condition, and family, the enforcement of said fine, would very much oppress. We the undersigned citizens of Bowling Green, and Warren Co, respectfully request your Excellency -- to remit said fine

Jas. H. Wilkins
Tom L Burnam
E B Suley
S, W, Coombs
Bennet Burnam
John A. Hughes
